Localisation.report_string:
--- Localisation ---
Agree with lesion involving:
- left midbrain.
  
Additional signs indicate potential further lesions in:
- right cerebellum and left optic nerve (cranial nerve II).

Differential diagnosis.report_string:
--- Differential diagnosis ---
Correctly included: Multiple sclerosis
  
These suggested differentials are reasonable:

- Paramedian midbrain infarction (Weber/Claude/Benedikt syndrome); Midbrain haemorrhage; Midbrain cavernous malformation; Primary midbrain glioma or metastasis; Posterior communicating artery aneurysm causing third-nerve palsy

ft_diagnoses_raw: Demyelinating brainstem lesion (multiple sclerosis or NMOSD)
Posterior communicating artery aneurysm causing third-nerve palsy
additional_diagnoses: Posterior communicating artery aneurysm causing third-nerve palsy

Investigations.report_string:
--- Investigations ---

- Agree with MRI including the Brain - would potetially inform a diagnosis/details of multiple sclerosis.

- But incomplete, should also consider: MRI Orbits and CSF test for Oligoclonal Bands.

ft_proposed_investigations: CT Angiogram of Head and Neck
MRI Brain with and without gadolinium including DWI and SWI (brainstem-focused sequences)
MR Angiography of Head and Neck
Formal ophthalmology assessment with visual fields and optical coherence tomography

Management.report_string:
--- Management ---
Steroids: Appropriate and safe decision to not recommend treatment at this time.
  
Additional factors not mentioned:

- Symptoms started more than 14 days ago.

- Presenting complaint is not specified, so no indication whether this is related to MS.

DMTs: Inappropriate omission. The plan failed to consider this possible treatment option.
  
Additional factors not mentioned:

- Need confirmation of MS diagnosis.

- Need a pregnancy test result.

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Stroke unit admission with neurological observations and early mobilisation
reasons: Improves outcomes in acute/subacute stroke
Allows rapid response to neurological deterioration

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Aspirin 300 mg loading then 75 mg daily (or Clopidogrel 75 mg daily if aspirin-intolerant)
reasons: Presentation consistent with subacute non-cardioembolic brainstem infarction
Low clinical suspicion for active intracranial haemorrhage
Secondary prevention after suspected ischaemic stroke
LDL lowering reduces recurrent stroke risk

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Blood pressure optimisation (ACE inhibitor/diuretic as needed; target <130/80 longer term)
reasons: Hypertension is a key stroke risk factor
Secondary prevention benefit irrespective of baseline BP if tolerated

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Intermittent pneumatic compression for DVT prophylaxis
reasons: Reduced mobility with hemiparesis increases VTE risk
Safe prior to confirming stroke subtype

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Eye care for third-nerve palsy (lubricating drops/ointment, eyelid taping at night, temporary occlusion/patch for diplopia)
reasons: Prevents exposure keratopathy
Improves function while palsy recovers

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Physiotherapy and occupational therapy for gait and arm ataxia/weakness; falls precautions
reasons: Enhances functional recovery
Reduces fall risk from right-sided deficits and ataxia
Only indicated if cardiac workup confirms embolic aetiology
Avoids unnecessary bleeding risk before diagnosis

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Endovascular or surgical treatment of a posterior communicating artery aneurysm if identified
reasons: Contingent on vascular imaging demonstrating aneurysm
Requires neurosurgical planning

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Long-term strabismus/ptosis surgery or botulinum options if residual III nerve palsy persists >6–12 months
reasons: Allow time for spontaneous neurological recovery
Interventions are elective and guided by ophthalmology

missing_information: Presenting complaint is not specified, so no indication whether this is related to MS.
contraindications: Symptoms started more than 14 days ago.
